programme.desc: Parker Posey and Eric McCormack star in this comedy about a couple who set out to build a new home and enlist the services of an uncompromising modernist architect who proceeds to build his dream house, instead of theirs.

programme.title: Different Flowers
programme.desc: Uptight Millie Haven (Emma Bell) has always followed the rules, but when she has doubts before her big Kansas City wedding, her attitude-prone little sister Emma (Hope Lauren), comes to the rescue. They embark on a spontaneous road trip to their grandmother's farm where, with the help of Grandma Mildred (Shelley Long), they rediscover their bond. They meet a local hunk with a heart of gold, and a host of only-in-the-Midwest characters as they pick up the pieces of Millie's life.

programme.title: The Electrifying & Magnanimous Return Of Beaverlamp
programme.desc: Max is delighted by Tara's suggestion that he reunite his rock band, Beaverlamp; Tara is turned away from further sessions by a strangely depressed Dr. Hattaras; Kate connects with frequent flyer Evan; Marshall and Noah stage a tense, revealing interview with Max for their film festival project.(c)

programme.title: Chicken 'n' Corn
programme.desc: A scare at a local corn maze leaves Tara shaken, and she later reveals a new alter that threatens Charmaine's baby and shows up at Dr. Hattaras' office as Alice, renewing his interest in her case; Kate escorts Max and Marshall to New York, where she introduces them to Evan and his unruly son; Charmaine meets a "fierce mommy" at a spa.(c)

programme.title: Certain Women
programme.desc: Michelle Williams, Kristen Stewart and Laura Dern star as three women striving to forge their own paths amidst the wide-open plains of the American Northwest. The lawyer (Dern) finds herself contending with both office sexism and a hostage situation. The wife and mother (Williams) has determination to build her dream home which puts her at odds with the men in her life. The young law student (Stewart) forms an ambiguous bond with a lonely ranch hand (Lily Gladstone).

programme.title: Miles To Go Before I Sleep
programme.desc: Short documentary chronicling the true story of famed musicians and the relationships they have with their roadies. Features music legends Chad Smith (Red Hot Chili Peppers), Chris Shiflett (Foo Fighters) and Jim James (My Morning Jacket), who speak candidly about their time on the road and the importance of the crew who work tirelessly to put the show together, as well as capturing a day behind-the-scenes with the crew of Pearl Jam.

programme.title: Madonna: Rebel Heart Tour
programme.desc: Concert special featuring the iconic superstar as she performs in packed arenas around the globe. Featuring new hits and beloved classics that showcase Madonna's signature visual theatrics, exquisite costumes and awe-inspiring choreography. With exclusive behind-the-scenes access that reveal the pop icon and her legion of dancers as they pour blood, sweat and tears into creating an astonishing arena show celebrated by fans around the world.

programme.title: The Hundred-Foot Journey
programme.desc: When a displaced Indian family opens a restaurant in the south of France, just 100 feet from a Michelin star restaurant, a culinary war ensues between the two establishments. Stars Academy Award® winner Helen Mirren.

programme.title: Employee of the Month (2006)
programme.desc: A slacker box boy (Dane Cook) at a New Mexico superstore tries to impress a gorgeous new coworker (Jessica Simpson) by transforming himself into a model corporate drone, but runs up against the previous 17-time holder (Dax Shepard) of the store's "employee of the month" honor.(n)

programme.title: Zack and Miri Make a Porno
programme.desc: As a way to pay off their mounting debts, lifelong pals Zack (Seth Rogen) and Miri (Elizabeth Banks) decide to write, direct and star in a pornographic movie, which they believe to be a sure moneymaker. But they may end up as the first couple in adult cinematic history that discovers long-hidden feelings for each other while doing so. Craig Robinson costars in this romantic sex comedy.(n)

programme.title: Certain Women
programme.desc: Michelle Williams, Kristen Stewart and Laura Dern star as three women striving to forge their own paths amidst the wide-open plains of the American Northwest. The lawyer (Dern) finds herself contending with both office sexism and a hostage situation. The wife and mother (Williams) has determination to build her dream home which puts her at odds with the men in her life. The young law student (Stewart) forms an ambiguous bond with a lonely ranch hand (Lily Gladstone).(n)

programme.title: Sleepless
programme.desc: When Las Vegas cop Vincent Downs (Jamie Foxx) and his partner Sean (Tip "T.I." Harris) rob a cocaine shipment bound for a drug-dealing casino boss (Dermot Mulroney), the desperate businessman retaliates by kidnapping Vincent's son (Octavius J. Johnson). Pursued by a dogged Internal Affairs investigator (Michelle Monaghan) and a sadistic drug kingpin (Scoot McNairy), Vincent must rely on his street smarts and sheer force of will as he tries to rescue his child over the course of a single night. Directed by Baran bo Odar.(n)

programme.title: Beyond the Opposite Sex
programme.desc: This documentary picks up the respective stories of Rene and Jamie, 13 years after their Gender Affirmation Surgeries. The two subjects let us back into their very changed worlds and find that their surgeries, which had been lifelong goals, were far from the finish line of their journeys - in fact, they turned out to be only the beginning of more difficult, arduous and true lifelong experiences.(n)

programme.title: Fair Haven
programme.desc: A young piano prodigy returns to his family farm, after a long stay in a gay conversion therapy, and is torn between the expectations of his emotionally distant father and the memory of a past, loving relationship he's tried to bury.(n)

programme.title: Prince: Sign 'o' the Times
programme.desc: This concert film features clips of live stage performances from Rotterdam and Minnesota, and is also interspersed with short films from the artist. Fan favorites, such as 'Little Red Corvette' and 'U Got the Look,' are performed as Prince is accompanied on stage by Sheena Easton and drummer Sheila E.(n)

programme.title: You, Me and Him
programme.desc: Two female lovers, one a career driven lawyer (Lucy Punch), the other a fun-loving, pot-smoking layabout (Faye Marsay), have an annoying Casanova neighbor (David Tennant). While neither woman ever wanted children, both end up pregnant, creating conflicts that cause each to re-examine their outlook on life and their relationship.(n)

programme.title: Behold the Monkey
programme.desc: A well-intentioned pensioner restores a fresco in a small Spanish town.(n)

programme.title: Don't Knock Twice
programme.desc: A successful sculptor named Jess returns to the UK to rebuild her relationship with Chloe, the daughter she was forced to give up nine years ago. When she agrees to come and live with her, Jess learns that Chloe has not come to stay because she wants to get to know her mother again. She has come because she is scared that a supernatural curse has claimed the life of her boyfriend, Danny, and is now coming for her. Chloe and Danny made the mistake of visiting an abandoned house once home to a witch, that comes for you if you knock on the door.(n)

programme.title: Bryce Will Play
programme.desc: Dr. Hattaras and Tara seek the help of another professional (guest star Robert Picardo) to deal with her violent new alter Bryce; Marshall is confused when his short film about Max clearly hurts his father's feelings; Charmaine hangs out with a group of "chic moms;" Kate continues her long distance relationship with Evan despite the interference of his son.(n)

programme.title: Train Wreck
programme.desc: Max and Marshall return home to disturbing news about Dr. Hattaras and Lionel, while Tara hides the existence of her new alter Bryce from her family; Neil lands a new job that will require him to move to Texas; Kate and Evan continue struggling to define their relationship.(n)

programme.title: Jackson
programme.desc: An intimate documentary look into the lives of three women caught up in the complex issues surrounding access to reproductive healthcare in the Deep South: Shannon Brewer, director of Jackson Women's Health Organization, the only remaining abortion clinic in Mississippi; Barbara Beaver, a leader of the anti-abortion movement, who runs the Center for Pregnancy Choices; and April Jackson, a young mother of four faced with another unplanned pregnancy.(n)

programme.title: Tim & Faith: Soul2Soul
programme.desc: Includes live performances from Tim McGraw and Faith Hill's 2017 Soul2Soul world tour, as well as an intimate look inside their relationship. Never before seen interviews are presented along side behind-the-scenes footage, capturing their chemistry on and off the stage. Directed and executive produced by the award-winning team of Dan Cutforth and Jane Lipsitz.(n)

programme.title: Prince: Sign 'o' the Times
programme.desc: This concert film features clips of live stage performances from Rotterdam and Minnesota, and is also interspersed with short films from the artist. Fan favorites, such as 'Little Red Corvette' and 'U Got the Look,' are performed as Prince is accompanied on stage by Sheena Easton and drummer Sheila E.(n)

programme.title: Lucky Break
programme.desc: Peter Cattaneo ("The Full Monty") directs this British comedy starring James Nesbitt as Jimmy Hands, a raffish robber assigned to a grim correctional facility. When the prison's governor (Christopher Plummer) is persuaded to stage a production of a misguided musical based on the story of Admiral Nelson and Lady Emma Hamilton, Jimmy and his buddies seize the opportunity to plan a jailbreak. However, complicating matters is a lovely therapist (Olivia Williams), who, cast as Jimmy's costar, steals his heart. Timothy Spall and Lennie James costar.(n)

programme.title: Baby Doll
programme.desc: The owner of a successful cotton company is married to a teenager who refuses to have sex with him until she's 20. When the man burns down a rival's business, the enemy tries to claim the wife as his compensation.

programme.title: Bridge to the Sun
programme.desc: An American woman living in Tokyo with her Japanese-diplomat husband during World War II endures not only culture shock and home sickness, but increasing suspicion and discomfort from her husband's government.

programme.title: Sylvia
programme.desc: A wealthy man (Peter Lawford) hires an investigator (George Maharis) to uncover the past of his fiancée (Carroll Baker). Jane: Joanne Dru. Irma: Viveca Lindfors. Oscar: Edmond O'Brien. Jonas: Aldo Ray. Mrs. Argona: Ann Sothern. Bruce: Lloyd Bochner. Gordon Douglas directed.

programme.title: Something Wild
programme.desc: A young woman who was raped attempts to cope with the trauma afterward by running away from her family and seeking shelter with a sweet auto mechanic.

programme.title: Star 80
programme.desc: Eric Roberts dominates Bob Fosse's story of actress-model Dorothy Stratten (Mariel Hemingway). Cliff Robertson, Carroll Baker. Nicholas: Roger Rees. Geb: David Clennon. Detective: Josh Mostel. Eileen: Lisa Gordon.

programme.title: Warlock
programme.desc: A gunman is hired to rid a town of outlaws. Richard Widmark, Henry Fonda, Anthony Quinn. Jessie: Dolores Michaels. Lilly: Dorothy Malone. Edward Dmytryk directed.

programme.title: The Guns of Navarone
programme.desc: During World War II, a crack team of six commandos undertakes a suicide mission to destroy two massive German guns that guard a strategic channel in the Aegean Sea and block Allied passage.

programme.title: The Shoes of the Fisherman
programme.desc: A Russian bishop becomes pope following his release from a Siberian prison, and attempts to prevent a nuclear war while helping the starving Red Chinese.

programme.title: Lust for Life
programme.desc: A dramatization of the life of Vincent van Gogh offers a portrait of the artist as a tormented man whose obsessive devotion to his work engulfs, consumes and finally destroys him. Kirk Douglas (as Vincent) was nominated for Best Actor, and Anthony Quinn won a Supporting Actor Oscar as his painting rival Paul Gauguin, despite a limited amount of screen time.

programme.title: Viva Zapata!
programme.desc: A cradle-to-grave biopic of the Mexican revolutionary Emiliano Zapata that follows him from his upbringing as a peasant to his miltary strikes with Pancho Villa. (cc).

programme.title: A High Wind in Jamaica
programme.desc: Adaptation of Richard Hughes' story "The Innocent Voyage," about children overjoyed to find themselves among pirates' booty. Anthony Quinn, James Coburn. Rosa: Lila Kedrova. Emily: Deborah Baxter. Mathias: Dennis Price. John: Martin Amis. Dutch Captain: Gert Frobe. Rachel: Roberta Tovey. Harry: Henry Beltran. Marpole: Kenneth J. Warren. Alberto: Benito Carruthers. Laura: Karen Flack. Edward: Jeffrey Chandler. Margaret: Viviane Ventura. Directed by Alexander Mackendrick.

programme.title: Requiem for a Heavyweight
programme.desc: A boxer at the end of his career has never taken a dive but is pressured to do so by his sleazy manager, who has bet against him in an upcoming bout.

programme.title: The Secret of Santa Vittoria
programme.desc: Italian villagers, led by their vino-loving mayor, celebrate the death of Mussolini, but then must try to outwit Nazis who are determined to plunder the town's vast store of wine.

programme.title: The Twenty-Fifth Hour
programme.desc: A Romanian peasant experiences the horrors of World War II when the Nazis invade his country and he is falsely labeled a Jew and sent to a work camp.

programme.title: La Strada
programme.desc: Federico Fellini's Oscar-winning Best Foreign Language Film is the tale of the relationship between a brutish carnival strongman and his simpleminded assistant as they tour the Italian countryside.

programme.title: Deaf Smith and Johnny Ears
programme.desc: Spaghetti western about a mercenary (Anthony Quinn) and his pal who fight a would-be dictator in 1834 Texas. Johnny Ears: Franco Nero. Susie: Pamela Tiffin. Morton: Franco Graziosi. Originally titled "Los Amigos." Directed by Paolo Cavara.

programme.title: Tomorrow the World!
programme.desc: Story of an American couple (Fredric March, Betty Field) who adopt a Nazi-indoctrinated German boy (Skippy Homeier). Agnes Moorehead, Joan Carroll. Excellent performances. Leslie Fenton directed.

programme.title: Our Vines Have Tender Grapes
programme.desc: A Norwegian father endeavors to raise his daughter with love and learning in a Wisconsin farming community during World War II.

programme.title: Scandal at Scourie
programme.desc: Religious and political conflicts arise in a Canadian town after a Protestant couple adopt an orphaned Catholic girl.

programme.title: Without Honor
programme.desc: Tale of adultery and a man's bitter hatred for his sister-in-law. Laraine Day. Dennis: Franchot Tone. Bill: Dane Clark. Katherine: Agnes Moorehead. Fred: Bruce Bennett. Good cast defeated by an overly contrived script. Irving Pichel directed.

programme.title: Meet Me in Las Vegas
programme.desc: Romance between a rancher (Dan Dailey) and a dancer (Cyd Charisse), with cameos as the jackpot. Agnes Moorehead. Sari: Lili Darvas. Tom: Jim Backus. Roy Rowland directed.

programme.title: Caged
programme.desc: Contact with criminals in a prison transforms a young woman into an embittered convict, where she fights to survive among brutal and hardened inmates. Eleanor Parker was nominated for Best Actress as the imprisoned woman and Hope Emerson received a Best Supporting Actress nod as the institution's sadistic matron. The screenplay was also Oscar nominated.

programme.title: Citizen Kane
programme.desc: After a multimillionaire newspaper magnate utters the mysterious name "Rosebud" on his deathbed, reporters scramble to decipher the word's meaning, touching off a fascinating series of flashbacks on his life, career and relationships. Orson Welles cowrote (and shared the Best Original Screenplay Oscar with Herman J. Mankiewicz), produced, directed and stars as Kane.

programme.title: Journey into Fear
programme.desc: Thriller about a U.S. engineer (Joseph Cotten) menaced by Nazi agents aboard a Greek cargo ship. Josette: Dolores Del Rio. Stephanie: Ruth Warrick. Mrs. Mathews: Agnes Moorehead. Haki: Orson Welles. Gogo: Jack Durant. Kopeikin: Everett Sloane. Haller: Eustace Wyatt. Captain: Richard Bennett. Intriguing despite a flawed and stylized treatment. Produced by Orson Welles. Screenplay by Welles and Joseph Cotten. Directed by Norman Foster (and uncredited Welles).

programme.title: The Magnificent Ambersons
programme.desc: Orson Welles' follow-up to "Citizen Kane" is this Best Picture nominee, an epic tale of the gradual decline of an old-monied Indianapolis family in the face of turn-of-the-century industrialization. The Ambersons' magnificent lives are apparent as the film opens, as is their sense of propriety. Welles, who directed, produced and adapted the screenplay from Booth Tarkington's novel, also provides the narration. Remade as a 2002 made-for-cable film. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Mrs. Parkington
programme.desc: A Nevada maid falls in love with and marries an ambitious mine owner, but when he moves them to a palatial estate in New York, they are spurned by Manhattan society. Greer Garson was nominated for Best Actress as the title character, while Agnes Moorehead received a nod as Best Supporting Actress.(n)

programme.title: Hush...Hush, Sweet Charlotte
programme.desc: A faded Southern belle with a horrible secret in her past goes to the brink of insanity following the arrival of her seemingly sweet-tempered cousin after spending years as a recluse in her decaying mansion.(n)

programme.title: Johnny Belinda
programme.desc: Jane Wyman won an Oscar for her portrayal of a deaf woman living a hardscrabble life in a Nova Scotia fishing village, where she is taught to communicate by a young doctor. Later, she is raped by a local lout, and charged when he is later found murdered. The film was nominated for 12 Oscars, including Best Picture, Director (Jean Negulesco) and Actor (Lew Ayres), but Wyman's was the only win.(n)

programme.title: The Big Street
programme.desc: A callous Broadway showgirl is adored by a naive nightclub busboy, who gets the chance to prove his love to her when he's injured.(n)

programme.title: The Kiss
programme.desc: Greta Garbo's last silent film: a melodrama centered on a woman whose love for an ex-boyfriend (Conrad Nagel) is squelched by her jealous husband (Anders Randolf) and a college boy (Lew Ayres). Durant: George Davis. Lassalle: Holmes Herbert.(n)

programme.title: Doorway to Hell
programme.desc: Underworld melodrama about the rise and fall of gangster Louis Ricarno (Lew Ayres). James Cagney is a stand-out as his double-crossing pal. Dorothy Mathews, Charles Judels, Leon Janney, Robert Elliott. Directed by Archie Mayo.(n)

programme.title: Spring Madness
programme.desc: Shenanigans involving a Harvard youth with wanderlust and a local college student vying for the affection of the same woman.(n)

programme.title: Remember?
programme.desc: A couple's marriage is troubled by the husband's workaholic nature, but their union gets a fresh start from a loss-of-memory potion that is provided to them by a mutual friend, who hopes they can happily get back together.(n)

programme.title: Young Dr. Kildare
programme.desc: This initial entry in the series has the young physician wrestling with whether to join his father's small-town practice or take an internship at a tough New York City hospital.(n)

programme.title: Calling Dr. Kildare
programme.desc: When a young hoodlum is shot, his sister (Lana Turner) urges Kildare (Lew Ayres) to operate without filing a police report. Lionel Barrymore. Mary: Laraine Day. Molly: Alma Kruger. Alice: Lynne Carver. Standard. Directed by Harold S. Bucquet.(n)

programme.title: The Unfaithful
programme.desc: While her husband is away, a housewife kills an intruder, who just happens to be her own former lover, leading to a web of secrets and betrayal.(n)

programme.title: Advise and Consent
programme.desc: Adaptation of Allen Drury's Pulitzer Prize-winning novel chronicles the various political machinations set in motion during the confirmation hearings involving the appointment of a controversial Secretary of State. Drury served as technical adviser on the film.(n)

programme.title: We're the Millers
programme.desc: A low-level pot dealer is forced to retrieve a big drug shipment from Mexico in order to pay off a debt to his supplier, and he gets a stripper and two teens to pose as his family during the trip. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Bad Words
programme.desc: A 40-year-old man enters the esteemed Golden Quill spelling bee, humiliating his young competitors at every turn in his quest to become the winner. Meanwhile, he befriends a lonely boy and deals with a reporter who wants to understand his motivations. (cc).

programme.title: Knocked Up
programme.desc: A mistake one-night stand becomes much more when a rising star TV personality realizes she's pregnant. A lifetime slacker is then thrust into responsibilities of fatherhood in this romp. (cc).

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Three private-school girls are among the seven fatalities found in a stash house, and a heroin trail leads to an Afghan drug lord with diplomatic immunity. Khalil: Christopher Maher. Raheem: Samrat Chakrabarti. Clark: Chris Sarandon. Jahss: Dylan Baker. Bardha: Sandor Tecsy. Capt. Wallace: Bryan Scott Johnson. Fontana: Dennis Farina. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: After a female civil-court judge (Lindsay Crouse) is shot in her building's garage, evidence points to a suspect the judge refuses to believe was involved. Grobman: John Heard. Dana Grobman: Debbon Ayer. Bobby Ward: Dominic Chianese Jr. Judge Pongracic: Charlotte Colavin. Claymore: Sam Groom. Mitchell Brizard: Jeff McCarthy. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The younger daughter of a wealthy family is found dead and the investigation involves two sons of rich friends. Pepper Garrison: Anne Twomey. Michael Garrison: Walter Bobbie. Mark Vance: Kenneth Garner. Mercedes Garrison: Francie Swift. Marianna Vance: Marianne Tatum. Nick Vance: Stephen Barker Turner. Ethan Vance: Eddie Kaye Thomas. Vondie: Ebony Jo-Ann. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Ross (Carey Lowell) returns to represent a previous client, who has key evidence concerning a prisoner on death row. Judge Wolinsky: Richard Masur. Simpson: John Michael Bolger. Gordon: Gordon Joseph Weiss. Holman: Maria Tucci. McCoy: Sam Waterston. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: While investigating the case of a purse-snatching victim who was fatally shot, Briscoe and Green (Jerry Orbach, Jesse L. Martin) clash over age and racial innuendoes. Bobby: Guillermo Diaz. Torres: Lauren Velez. Flaco: Richard Barboza. Mercer: Kerrianne Spellman Cort. Brenda: Claire Beckman. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The investigation regarding a woman found comatose in her apartment opens an unusual case involving murder and a possible frame-up. Ken Taylor: Sebastian Roche. Charles Garnett: James Rebhorn. Judge Boucher: Lynne Thigpen. Det. O'Malley: Kevin O'Rourke. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A taxi driver finds that his passenger is dead and the resulting case involves an insurance scam and Holocaust victims. Jordan Grimaldi: Matt Servitto. Stewart: Henderson Forsythe. Bresler: Philip Goodwin. Arthur Gold: George Grizzard. Donna: Jacqueline Antaramian. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A patient is found beaten to death in a hospital lounge---and the resulting case involves infidelity, Alzheimer's disease and a ladies' man. William Hallenbeck: George Martin. Lisa: Missy Yager. Michael: Bradley White. Anne Paulsen: Glynnis O'Connor. Raymond Quinn: Mark Pinter. McCoy: Sam Waterston. Briscoe: Jerry Orbach. Green: Jesse L. Martin. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: After a 16-year-old boy's body is found by sanitation workers, the investigation leads to another teen (Jacob Pitts), whose father (Robert Clohessy) bought the murder weapon. Sandra Telford: Julie Boyd. Granick: Ned Eisenberg. Judge: John Carter. McCoy: Sam Waterston. Schiff: Steven Hill. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The investigation of a schizophrenic woman's death leads to a case involving a homeless man and his right to refuse medication. Harvey Bower: Seth Barrish. Danielle Melnick: Tovah Feldshuh. Phil Bower: Joseph Hindy. Myrna Bower: Marcia Jean Kurtz. Ron Brewster: Bill Marcus. Teresa Brewster: Roberta Maxwell. Briscoe: Jerry Orbach. Green: Jesse L. Martin. McCoy: Sam Waterston. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: While You Were Sleeping
programme.desc: A lonely turnstile clerk saves a man who has fallen onto the tracks, then poses as the comatose man's fiancée to gain access to his condition. (cc).

programme.title: Knocked Up
programme.desc: A mistake one-night stand becomes much more when a rising star TV personality realizes she's pregnant. A lifetime slacker is then thrust into responsibilities of fatherhood in this romp. (cc).

programme.title: Definitely, Maybe
programme.desc: A political consultant in the midst of a bitter divorce attempts to delicately divulge the truth about his past relationships to his curious young daughter, who simply won't stop asking questions until she's satisfied with all the answers. (cc).

programme.title: The Intern

programme.title: War for the Planet of the Apes
programme.desc: In the third installment of the "Planet of the Apes" prequel series, simian leader Caesar seeks revenge on the humans who killed his family. In time, his vendetta threatens to ignite all-out war between the two species. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Orphan
programme.desc: A seemingly angelic orphan named Esther exhibits an unforeseen devilish streak shortly after arriving at her new home. Devastated by a recent miscarriage, aspiring parents John and Kate decide to adopt 9-year-old Esther. But once she's welcomed into their family, she begins to display some deeply unsettling behavior. As tragedy looms, John and Kate race to convince everyone else that Esther is pure evil. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Good Lie
programme.desc: Fifteen years after being orphaned by Sudan's civil war, 3600 displaced refugees known as the 'Lost Boys' get a chance at a new life when a massive humanitarian effort aims to bring them to America. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Duplicity
programme.desc: Two rival corporate spies and former government employees begin a clandestine love affair as they try to outwit and double-cross each other. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Conan the Barbarian
programme.desc: A warrior named Conan seeks revenge on the man who killed his parents, but is tasked with helping save the daughter of a king who has come under the spell of the same man who Conan seeks to slaughter. (cc).

programme.title: Conan the Destroyer
programme.desc: In the first sequel to the 1982 original, Conan must escort the niece of a nasty queen on a mission to find a magical gem. In return, the queen will resurrect his dead love. (cc).

programme.title: Kong Skull Island
programme.desc: A disillusioned soldier and a photojournalist join an expedition to Skull Island, an uncharted territory in the Pacific. There, the group get caught up in an ongoing war between a gigantic ape called King Kong and the area's indigenous predators. (cc).

programme.desc: Eli roams a postapocalyptic world, protecting a sacred tome that offers guidance on how to rebuild humanity. The evil Carnegie goes to great lengths to acquire the powerful book, but Carnegie's adopted daughter, who wants to escape her dad's clutches, helps Eli. (cc).

programme.title: Nell
programme.desc: A young woman living in an isolated North Carolina cabin is discovered by a small-town doctor, who is fascinated by her and attempts to introduce her to the world. Based on the play "Idioglossia" by Mark Handley. (cc).

programme.title: Kingdom of Heaven
programme.desc: A blacksmith joins the Crusades and tries to achieve peace between Muslims and Christians. Meanwhile, violent agitators on both sides foolishly strive to end the peace in a bid for greater power. (cc).

programme.title: Taken

programme.desc: World War II epic follows a squad of GIs advancing on Guadalcanal. One solider, Private Witt, is a deserter living in peace and harmony with the natives of a Pacific island paradise. However, Witt's respite from war is brief as he's captured by the Navy and forced back into combat. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Get Out
programme.desc: While visiting his white girlfriend's family, an African-American man discovers that their seemingly idyllic community is hiding a sinister conspiracy—one that involves the disappearance of several black people in the area. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Split
programme.desc: Three teenagers are kidnapped and imprisoned by a man with multiple-personality disorder, and must plot their escape without ever knowing which of his 23 personas—young or old, male or female, benign or monstrous—they will confront on the way out. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Inherent Vice
programme.desc: In this offbeat detective story set in 1970 California, a drug-addled private eye investigates a conspiracy involving his ex-flame and her married, real-estate-developer boyfriend. Meanwhile, various eccentric characters complicate the investigation. (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Bourne Supremacy
programme.desc: While still on the lam, amnesiac Jason Bourne is framed for a CIA operation gone wrong. Bourne is then cornered into using his accomplished assassin techniques to fight for survival and clear his name. (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Outsiders
programme.desc: Members of rival local gangs, distinguished by the haves and the have-nots, get into a scuffle that results in death in 1960s Oklahoma. (cc).

programme.title: Erin Brockovich
programme.desc: Oscar winner Julia Roberts as a sassy, low-level law-office worker who becomes obsessed with a case involving a California utility company that's accused of polluting the drinking water in a small town. The real-life Erin Brockovich has a cameo as a waitress named Julia. (cc).

programme.title: The Client
programme.desc: An 11-year-old boy, who has witnessed a suicide, hires an attorney to protect himself and his family from mobsters. (cc).

programme.title: Hoffa
programme.desc: A biography of the Teamsters Union boss is told in flashbacks from his rise and fall as a labor reformer to his disappeared in 1975. (cc).

programme.title: Everything Must Go
programme.desc: An alcoholic businessman holds a yard sale after being fired from his job and thrown out of the house along with his belongings by his fed-up wife. While living on his front lawn, he unexpectedly makes friends with a neighborhood kid and tries to reconnect with a girl he loved in high school. (cc).

programme.title: Public Enemies
programme.desc: Director Michael Mann's historical crime drama follows the efforts of top FBI agent Melvin Purvis in capturing notorious bank robber John Dillinger. A folk hero to the American public, Dillinger was virtually unstoppable at the height of his criminal career. J. Edgar Hoover's FBI was just being formed, and in order to turn his fledgling agency into a national police force, Hoover recruits Purvis to catch the most-elusive criminal in the country. (cc).

programme.title: Taking Woodstock
programme.desc: Demetri Martin stars in this historical comedy-drama about the celebrated 1969 festival of peace and love. Martin plays Elliot Teichberg, an interior designer who offers to help out the promoters of Woodstock when they lose their permit to have the concert. He provides a space for the show, but must think on his feet when the entire event becomes much larger than he imagined. Directed by Ang Lee. Eugene Levy, Emile Hirsch, Liev Schreiber. (cc).

programme.title: Our Family Wedding
programme.desc: Two headstrong fathers (Forest Whitaker, Carlos Mencia) struggle to put their personal differences aside as their son and daughter prepare to tie the knot. (cc).

programme.title: Selena
programme.desc: Biopic of the Tejano singer who was gunned down by an assistant at the height of her fame. The focus is primarily on Selena's relationship with her family, including her demanding manager-father, and her rise to stardom. (cc).

programme.title: The Zookeeper's Wife
programme.desc: A husband and wife in Nazi-occupied Poland use their positions as caretakers at the Warsaw Zoo to shepherd Jews out of the country. Based on a true story. (cc).

programme.title: Split
programme.desc: Three teenagers are kidnapped and imprisoned by a man with multiple-personality disorder, and must plot their escape without ever knowing which of his 23 personas—young or old, male or female, benign or monstrous—they will confront on the way out. (cc).

programme.title: Taken

programme.title: Going in Style

programme.title: Something's Gotta Give
programme.desc: An aging Lothario falls for the playwright mother of his much younger girlfriend. (cc).

programme.title: Addicted to Love
programme.desc: Jilted lovers team up to seek revenge against their exes---and end up falling for each other. (cc).

programme.title: Happy Tears
programme.desc: Sisters Jayne (Parker Posey) and Laura (Demi Moore) reunite in Pittsburgh to care for their father, whose poor health hasn't stopped him from pursuing a romance with a suspicious woman (Ellen Barkin), much to the consternation of the two sisters. Rip Torn. (cc).

programme.title: Chaos

programme.title: An Innocent Man
programme.desc: Tom Selleck plays a California airline mechanic sent to prison on trumped-up drug charges. Virgil: F. Murray Abraham. Kate: Laila Robins. Mike: David Rasche. Danny: Richard Young. John: Badja Djola. Robby: Todd Graff. Malcolm: M.C. Gainey. Directed by Peter Yates. (cc).

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding
programme.desc: The proud Portokalos clan reels from the news that thirtysomething daughter (Nia Vardalos) has fallen for a teacher (John Corbett) who is not Greek. The rare romantic comedy that's actually both romantic and funny. Vardalos earned an Oscar nomination for her screenplay, which is adapted from her one-woman stage show. Michael Constantine and Lainie Kazan are excellent as the bride's parents. Directed by Joel Zwick; Rita Wilson and Tom Hanks are among the producers. (cc).

programme.title: Lucas

programme.title: Swimming With Sharks

programme.title: The Mummy Returns
programme.desc: Adventurer Rick O'Connell (Brendan Fraser) once again battles the resurrected mummy in this sequel to the 1999 hit. Loud, absurd escapist fare with kitschy special effects. Evelyn “Evie” O'Connell: Rachel Weisz. Jonathan Carnahan: John Hannah. Stephen Sommers directed. . (cc).

programme.title: Conan the Destroyer
programme.desc: In the first sequel to the 1982 original, Conan must escort the niece of a nasty queen on a mission to find a magical gem. In return, the queen will resurrect his dead love. (cc).

programme.title: A Perfect Getaway
programme.desc: An idyllic Hawaiian vacation turns into a nightmare when Cydney and Cliff (Milla Jovovich and Steve Zahn) discover their lives are in danger from a psychotic killer who is hunting visitors to the island. programme.desc: Phaedra prepares to give birth by heading to Augusta to see her doctor. Meanwhile, NeNe tries to land a post as an entertainment reporter at a local TV station, but one of her scoops stirs up drama at Sheree's party later.

programme.title: The Real Housewives of Atlanta
programme.desc: Phaedra brings her new baby home from the hospital, and Kim attempts to tell her daughter about the facts of life. Meanwhile, NeNe's relationship problems are exposed in a public way, leaving her marriage at breaking point.

programme.title: The Real Housewives of Atlanta
programme.desc: Kim meets the vocal coach who previously criticised her singing skills. Meanwhile, Sheree auditions for a talent agency, Phaedra enjoys parenthood and drama occurs at the FastLife drag race.

programme.title: Lip Sync Battle

programme.desc: A 23-year-old Rotherham hairdresser with a fondness for revealing outfits, and a 25-year-old `pinkaholic' from Nottingham get a restyle to change their outrageous look.

programme.title: Queer Eye
programme.desc: The team help a man prepare a friendly dinner party to introduce his girlfriend to his godmother, who raised him after his mother died.

programme.title: Queer Eye

programme.title: Queer Eye
programme.sub-title: Do You Know the Mullet Man?: Mark Faries
programme.desc: The Fab Five are called in to help make over a man whose mullet hairdo is only the beginning of the changes required - the last time he cooked for his wife was on their first date.

programme.title: Queer Eye
programme.sub-title: Taking on the Twins: Brandon and David B
programme.desc: Twins need help to spruce up and host a family party for their grandad's 80th birthday, and call in the Fab Five, who quickly set to work.

programme.title: Queer Eye
programme.desc: The stylish team are called in to help a man married to a fashionable handbag designer create the right look, and develop the necessary social skills to boost his wife's career.

programme.title: One Night with My Ex
programme.desc: Another three former couples spend 24 hours alone together to discuss their unfinished business. First, ex-fiances' Paul and Phil come together for an emotional reunion, after Paul left the relationship without saying a word. Next to meet up are ex-couple King and Daisy, whose fiery relationship broke down after suspicions of cheating, and Lauren and Blake, who broke up three years ago.

programme.desc: Olivia reveals her troubled relationship with her mom. Jim's mom Nancy is working hard to improve relations with Chrissy. Kimbella tries to make up with Emily by throwing her a party.(c)

programme.title: Lip Sync Battle
programme.sub-title: Lip Sync Battle All Stars Special
programme.desc: Olympic swimmer Michael Phelps takes on some of the show's most memorable past champions - singer-songwriter John Legend, NFL star-turned-actor Terry Crews and actress and model Olivia Munn. Phelps launches into Eminem's Lose Yourself, recreating the rapper's 8 Mile anthem, Crews performs an energetic take on Public Enemy's Fight the Power, Munn offers a circus-inspired performance of Cheap Thrills by Sia, while Legend transforms his appearance for the Outkast hit Hey Ya!, with Stevie Wonder on keyboards. Presented by LL Cool J, with commentary by Chrissy Teigen.

programme.title: Słoiki
programme.desc: Prawdzie historie ludzi, którzy przyjechali do Warszawy, by odmienić swoje życie. Mieszkańcy niewielkich miast i wsi liczą, że w stolicy uda im się zrealizować marzenia o lepszej pracy i pieniądzach. Nie łatwo jest im jednak odnaleźć się w wielkomiejskiej rzeczywistości.

programme.title: Eska On The Beach
programme.desc: Wakacyjny program Eski TV nadawany prosto z najpiękniejszych plaż. Ola Kot zaprezentuje widzom wiele ciekawostek, a wśród nich najnowsze plotki, porady modowe oraz wieści muzyczne z kraju i ze świata. Nie zabraknie najnowszych piosenek i teledysków. Widzowie przekonają się, który utwór zasłuży sobie na miano hitu lata.

programme.title: Eska Summer City news
programme.desc: Twórcy programu odwiedzają miejsca, w których odbywają się najciekawsze wakacyjne wydarzenia. Zawitają zarówno do największych polskich miast, jak i mniejszych ośrodków. Pojawią się na imprezach plenerowych, w klubach, na plażach, basenach, aquaparkach czy zawodach sportowych. Prowadzący zapytają napotkane tam osoby o to, jak spędzają lato i gdzie wypoczywają. Nie zabraknie rozmów z gwiazdami i gości specjalnych.

programme.title: Projekt Kamper
programme.desc: Filip Rudanacja zamienia swojego garbusa na atrakcyjnego kampera i wyrusza na wakacyjną wyprawę. Prowadzący oddaje się paradzie letnich wyzwań. Wypoczywa, szuka dobrej zabawy przy dźwiękach najlepszej muzyki i robi rzeczy, które każdy powinien wykonać podczas urlopu, jak zjedzenie gofra, czy rozstawienie parawanu.

programme.title: Eska Summer City news
programme.desc: Twórcy programu odwiedzają miejsca, w których odbywają się najciekawsze wakacyjne wydarzenia. Zawitają zarówno do największych polskich miast, jak i mniejszych ośrodków. Pojawią się na imprezach plenerowych, w klubach, na plażach, basenach, aquaparkach czy zawodach sportowych. Prowadzący zapytają napotkane tam osoby o to, jak spędzają lato i gdzie wypoczywają. Nie zabraknie rozmów z gwiazdami i gości specjalnych.

Pojawią się na imprezach plenerowych, w klubach, na plażach, basenach, aquaparkach czy zawodach sportowych. Prowadzący zapytają napotkane tam osoby o to, jak spędzają lato i gdzie wypoczywają. Nie zabraknie rozmów z gwiazdami i gości specjalnych.

programme.title: The Adventures of Kid Danger
programme.desc: Schwoz accidentally morphs Charlotte into a hybrid of half girl-half octopus. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: The SpongeBob SquarePants Movie
programme.desc: The first big-screen adventure of the popular children's (and adults') cartoon series follows SpongeBob as he sets out to retrieve King Neptune's stolen crown, save Mr. Krabs, who has been accused of the theft, and stymie Plankton and his plot for world domination. (repeat).

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: The gang heads to Barbados for Ross's paleontologist seminar, where his speech leaves Charlie speechless---and Rachel ready to tell Joey too much. Meanwhile, Mike (Paul Rudd) makes a last-minute move to woo Phoebe away from David (Hank Azaria); and Monica's secret ping-pong passion rears its ugly, unruly head. Oberblau: John Balma. Klarik: Robert Alan Beuth. (repeat).

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One After Joey and Rachel Kiss
programme.desc: Rachel and Joey struggle to tell Ross about their kiss in Barbados, while Monica comes up with a corny fix for her rapidly growing 'fro. Back in New York, Phoebe is forced to dump Mike's girlfriend for him after realizing that she's engaged to another woman's beau. Precious: Anne Dudek. Charlie: Aisha Tyler. Mike: Paul Rudd. (repeat).
